bestBHT.bht: The betrayer's proximity to the Betrayed is vividly portrayed in this description, depicting a close and trusted relationship, as seen in one dipping in the same dish. Although the others fail to notice it, Jesus gives a sign by giving the sop to the one who dips with Him, indicating that this person is the betrayer. Judas, fully apprehending this, realizes that Jesus is aware of his intentions. For more details, refer to Matthew 26:21-24.

Henry Alford: This description of the traitor here again does not seem to designate one especially, nor to describe an action at that moment proceeding, but, as before, pathetically to describe the near relation of the betrayer to the Betrayed.
Now however the relation pointed out is still closer than before—it is that of one dipping in the same dish—one of nearest and most trusted.
Archibald T. Robertson: The sign that Jesus gave, the one dipping in the dish with me, escaped the notice of all.
Jesus gave the sop to Judas who understood perfectly that Jesus knew his purpose.
See on Matthew 26:21-24 for further details.
John Gill: In order to relieve their minds, and point out the particular person.
It is one of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.

bhtAttempts.bht: At this moment, the betrayer's close relationship to the one he betrayed is emphasized by the fact that they were dipping in the same dish. This symbolizes a near and trusted bond. Although not immediately recognized by the others, Jesus gave a sign that the one dipping with Him in the dish was the betrayer. Judas fully understood this and realized that Jesus knew his intentions. This event can be further explored in Matthew 26:21-24 for more context.

The betrayer's proximity to the Betrayed is vividly portrayed in this description, depicting a close and trusted relationship, as seen in one dipping in the same dish. Although the others fail to notice it, Jesus gives a sign by giving the sop to the one who dips with Him, indicating that this person is the betrayer. Judas, fully apprehending this, realizes that Jesus is aware of his intentions. For more details, refer to Matthew 26:21-24.

This description of the betrayer underscores their profound connection to the one they betrayed, emphasizing the intimate relationship they once shared, as depicted by dipping in the same dish. Despite going unnoticed by the others, Jesus discreetly signals the identity of the betrayer by offering the sop to the one involved in this shared action. Judas, comprehending this gesture, realizes that Jesus is fully aware of his intentions. Additional insights can be found in Matthew 26:21-24.

The betrayer's deep connection to the one who betrayed is poignantly illustrated in this passage, revealing their close and trusted relationship as they share in dipping from the same dish. While this act goes unnoticed by the others, Jesus subtly signals the identity of the betrayer by handing the sop to the one partaking in this shared action. Judas, fully aware of the implications, recognizes that Jesus is aware of his intentions. For further details, please refer to Matthew 26:21-24.

The description of the betrayer in this verse serves to highlight their close relationship with the one they would betray, as they were depicted as dipping in the same dish, symbolizing their nearness and trust. Though the others were oblivious, Jesus discreetly revealed the betrayer's identity through the act of giving them the sop. Judas, fully understanding the implication, realized that Jesus was fully aware of his intentions. For more details, explore Matthew 26:21-24.
